creator: akshata_sm@yahoo.com
text:
The logs display "WARN - jmeter.gui.tree.JMeterTreeListener: Shouldn't be here" for few samplers after execution.

These warnings do not affect the execution nor stop the testing activity. But the samplers appear as failed when associated assertions fail. 

This confuses the executor and results in display of a failure inspite of no failures.

Created attachment 22783
Attached is the jmx snippet which displays me the warning
creator: akshata_sm@yahoo.com

text:
(In reply to comment #0)
> The logs display "WARN - jmeter.gui.tree.JMeterTreeListener: Shouldn't be here"
> for few samplers after execution.

Having looked at the code I don't think the log message should be there at all.

The code is called in normal operation when the mouse is released after a drag operation.

If anything, the log message applies to itself!

> These warnings do not affect the execution nor stop the testing activity. But
> the samplers appear as failed when associated assertions fail. 

That is what assertions are supposed to do.
The log message does not affect this.
 
> This confuses the executor and results in display of a failure inspite of no
> failures.
> 

As above, failed assertions are supposed to do this.
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
I've removed the warning message:

URL: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=708896&view=rev
Log:
Bug 41608 - misleading warning log message removed
